qas.question: What is the Manueline style also known as?

answers.text: a sumptuous, composite Portuguese style of architectural ornamentation of the first decades of the 16th century

qas.question: Who are some of the most renowned architects to come from Portugal?

answers.text: Eduardo Souto de Moura, Álvaro Siza Vieira (both Pritzker Prize winners) and Gonçalo Byrne

qas.question: For what is Tomas Taveira particularly noteworthy for in Portugal?

context: Traditional architecture is distinctive and include the Manueline, also known as <a0_0>Portuguese late Gothic<a0_0/>, <a1_0>a sumptuous, composite Portuguese style of architectural ornamentation of the first decades of the 16th century<a1_0/>. <a2_0>A 20th-century interpretation of traditional architecture<a2_0/>, Soft Portuguese style, appears extensively in major cities, especially Lisbon. Modern Portugal has given the world renowned architects like <a3_0>Eduardo Souto de Moura, Álvaro Siza Vieira (both Pritzker Prize winners) and Gonçalo Byrne<a3_0/>. In Portugal Tomás Taveira is also noteworthy, particularly for <a4_0>stadium design<a4_0/>.
